snippet: The Obama administration warned that food supplies were at risk from the worsening drought and called on Congress to revive lapsed disaster aid programs.
abstract: Obama administration warns that food supplies are at risk from the worsening drought afflicting more than half of the country, calling on Congress to revive lapsed disaster aid programs; Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack says that 1,297 counties, or roughly a third of those in the nation, have been designated disaster areas.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration warned that food supplies were at risk from the worsening drought and called on Congress to revive lapsed disaster aid programs.

headline.main: Drought Puts Food at Risk, U.S. Warns
headline.print_headline: Drought Puts Food at Risk, U.S. Warns
